parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.08

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Identity

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the name of a location or a person. In Arma 3 this can be used to set [[name]] of a person but only in single player.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setName''' name

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> name: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value>[[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> unit '''setName''' [name, firstName, lastName]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]
 </value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [name, firstName, lastName]: [[Array]]
</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> name: [[String]]
</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> firstName: [[String]]
</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> lastName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s3</name>=<value> location '''setName''' name

</value></part><part><name>p31</name>=<value> location: [[Location]]
</value></part><part><name>p32</name>=<value> name: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>r3</name>=<value>[[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>myLocation [[setName]] "My Location Name";</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setName]] "New Name";</code>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setName]] ["Ben Kerry","Ben","Kerry"];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[name]], [[nameSound]], [[setNameSound]], [[setIdentity]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 9, 2010‎</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Appears to be only for the 3d editor.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 19, 2013‎</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Druid|Druid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Support of a person as the first parameter from Arma 3 v. 1.02.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 12, 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Waffle SS.|Waffle SS.]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Seems to have no effect on players in Multiplayer. (Arma 3 v1.00)

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 18, 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Only last name will appear in command bar i.e. this setname _mynameArray will display _mynameArray select 2. If setname is used with a string : this setname "blah", nothing occurs in command bar and default randomized name is displayed.
<br><br>
Dealing with the units' names in a script, _x (in a foreach units group, for example) will return the "object" as B ALFA 4-1:2 or the name written in ai unit name field in editor (if exists). This context is rather a "variable name" for each object (ai) than an "identity name" as given via setname function.
<BR><BR>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
